import React from "react"; import "./PrivacyPolicy.css"; const PrivacyPolicy = () => { return (

Privacy Policy

Last Updated: June 12, 2023

Thank you for visiting Mentor A Promise, Inc. ("us," "we," or "our") website. This Privacy Policy outlines how we collect, use, and protect the personal information you provide while using our website. We are committed to maintaining the privacy and confidentiality of your personal information and strive to handle it responsibly.

Information We Collect

We collect personal information from you when you voluntarily submit it through our contact form, registration form, and program enrollment form. The information we collect may include but is not limited to:

  • Full Name
  • Address
  • Contact Information (Email, Phone)
  • Emergency Contact Information (Name, Email, Phone)
  • Date of Birth
  • Gender

Use of Personal Information

We use the personal information collected from you for the following purposes:

  • To communicate with you and respond to your inquiries.
  • To process registrations for our programs and events.
  • To provide you with updates, newsletters, and relevant information about our organization, programs, and events.
  • To improve our website, services, and user experience.
  • To comply with legal obligations.

Protection of Personal Information

We implement reasonable security measures to protect the personal information you provide from unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, or destruction. However, please note that no method of transmission over the internet or electronic storage is 100% secure, and we cannot guarantee absolute security.

Sharing of Personal Information

We do not sell, trade, or rent your personal information to third parties. However, we may share your information with trusted service providers who assist us in operating our website and conducting our activities. These service providers are bound by confidentiality agreements and are only authorized to use your personal information as necessary to provide the requested services.

Children's Privacy

Protecting the privacy of children is of utmost importance to us. If we collect personal information from individuals under the age of 13, we do so with parental or guardian consent. We encourage parents and guardians to be actively involved in their children's online activities and to contact us if they believe their child has provided personal information without their consent. We will promptly remove any such information from our records.

Third Party Websites

Our website may contain links to third-party websites. Please note that we are not responsible for the privacy practices or content of those websites. We encourage you to review the privacy policies of any third-party websites you visit.

Updates to Privacy Policy

We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices or legal requirements. We will post the revised version on our website and indicate the "Last updated" date at the top of the page. Your continued use of our website after the posting of any changes constitutes your acceptance of those changes.

Contact Us

If you have any questions, concerns, or requests regarding this Privacy Policy or the handling of your personal information, please contact us using the information provided below:

); }; export default PrivacyPolicy;
